reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We exchanged through RCI - top notch timeshare and got something much less. Unit was average in size for a 2 bedroom but very tired and run down. Reservations were for an ocean view but that didn't happen. There was no view unless you like to watch at the Hilton Hotel driveway across the lagoon. Could see the spa and workout room across the water but could not use them. The pool area was average for a motel 6 on the interstate. The resort as a whole was was a big let down. We spent the $15.00 a day to enjoy the Hilton Pool next door, service and staff there were much better.The staff was lacking in service, maintenance crew was uninterested in making accommodation's when they turned off the water for several hours one day. Lihue is a great central location on the island, but these villas aren't the vision of Hawaii you have, however the Windham Resorts has purchased the property and that may give hope to a major renovation, the only way we would come back. Would definitely stay at the Hilton or Marriott on this side of the island.
reviews.title: Not so great

reviews.text: Exchanged via RCI for a one bedroom unit. As we had another couple with us, we upgraded to a two bedroom two bathroom unit for $233. Unit was very generous in size - we especially liked the large deck. Unfortunately, we did not get an ocean view - those were great views! but our view of the lagoon and fountains was nice.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We loved walking on the beach here!
reviews.title: Great View!

reviews.text: We especially liked being in the center of the island so drives sight-seeing were not as long as being situated way up north.
reviews.title: We love KBV!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are lots of chickens, ducks, roosters, etc. but they seem to be everywhere in Kuaui! The motorcyclists didn't really bother us because we were usually gone from the unit when they were there.
reviews.title: E-5 is pretty good

reviews.text: We stayed here for 10 days as part of an 17 day stay in Kauai. We booked a 2 BR 2 BTH unit through our timeshare and were not disappointed. First of all, it is a 5 min ride from the airport, so after the LONG flights from the East Coast, we were happy to arrive quickly. We were impressed with the room particularly after reading some of the other reviews. There were two large bedrooms, a large kitchen, dining room area, two full bathrooms, and a large living room area. There was also a deck with a table, chairs, and a lounge chair. The amount of space was awesome particularly as we had four people staying there comfortably, but you could have had six easily. Our unit also had a washer and dryer and it was great to be able to clean our clothes halfway through the trip. The room was stocked with plenty of bath towels, beach towels, and kitchenware for cooking or drinks.
reviews.title: Great Place for a Home Base on Kauai!
Anniversay fun
reviews.text: They do a timeshare presentation and offer a free hot breakfast...in my opinion, the breakfast was not all you can eat (they fixed you a plate) and the eggs were awful!! The info they gave was pretty good, so I would attend for that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As other people have said, the grounds are not the most phenomenal, but you have everything you need. The beach is not swimmable here, but it is a lovely spot to have a glass of wine and watch the waves crash on the beach. The pool is smaller, but wasn't at all busy when we were there. The hot tub was small, but unbelievably relaxing especially because it's not really so warm every day in February. The pool area has a bunch of BBQ's for grilling that people were using and having a bit of a party around. The office has a nice library of books to borrow and share - perfect for beach reads.
reviews.title: Great location - nice place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton across the street does have a very nice pool and while it is suggested that you pay $15 to use it, as long as you don't take your Kauai Beach Villa colored towel, you can go and no one will question if you are a guest. DO NOT MISS the all you can eat seafood buffet at the Hilton including crab legs. The food was absolutely phenomenal. My husband and I are big food snobs and it was a deal to have dinner there....fresh sushi, great poke, nice fresh salads and great service. You would not think a hotel would have such good food, but they did.
reviews.title: A Delightful Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone talks about the roosters, but you are going to see them everywhere. Trust me. We traveled the entire island and they are everywhere. They were even 1000 ft up a mountain we climbed....you will not escape them or their crowing. I actually thought they were charming.
reviews.title: Perfect Location for seeing Kaua'i for first time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a good centrally located resort on Kauai to explore from if you've never been there! The beach is nice, but not very exciting to swim in, just like most every other beach on Kauai. It's about 30 miles to the northern dead end of the island, and about 35 miles to the southern dead end of the island (paved). It's about 10 miles from Poipu, a very nice, swimmable southern end beach.
reviews.title: Great place to explore from! Unit G-4

likes.disliked: — Lack of A/C in every room.

reviews.title: Really enjoyed it!
reviews.text: The room was spacious, very lightly decorated. As far as size this was above average for a 1 bedroom. A/C only in the bedroom, which takes some getting used to in August! Our A/C fizzled out, but they had it replaced within a day from when we notified them. Unit G-4 had a partial ocean view, which was a nice surprise, because we booked the lowest value unit we could using Wyndham Fairshare Plus points.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Five members of our family stayed at the Kauai Beach Villas and we loved it. Our condo was right on the beach and had unbelievable views. You do have to get used to how windy it is on this part of the island, hard to bbq. The one negative was that the pool for the complex was a joke. Not even worth going to. Our pool in our home in Florida is bigger, and the jacuzzi was ridiculously small for that size of a complex. The noise from the adjacent dirt bike track was not an issue for the condos that are located on the water, but might be if you're towards the southeastern part of the property away from the ocean.
reviews.title: Great Time

likes.disliked: — Beach is for walking not swimming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to the islands and we did want a beach view. We stayed in G-6 at the Villas and got an excellent view off our balcony! The room was clean and looked exactly like the pictures we were shown to rent it. The kitchen had everything you needed to cook, washer/dryer, hairdryer, they provided beach towels, boogie boards, snorkle gear, and beach mats! I thought that was a nice touch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, we come to Hawaii every year an we own timeshares with Wyndham(not at Kauai Beach Villas). This was the first time we were at this resort. Being at numerous Wyndham locations, this was somewhat a letdown. However, I think they are in the process of making changes. I know part was owned by Pahio, etc. To get to it all, it does have large units and a decent lanai. It is outdated a bit, but it definitely is livable. The rooms have all the amenities with kitchens, washer dryer, etc. The pool is hideously small along with the hottub. It sounds ridiculous to say that the pool is not heated because you are in Hawaii. However, the weather gets very chilly at night and the pool never warms up. Picture immersing yourself in a bathtub filled with only the cold water faucet. Needless to say not many people swim unless it is extremely hot out. People complain that the roosters crow all the time, yes they do. Shut your windows if that is a problem. Chickens run this island. The dirt race track only goes on weekends. Who sits in their room all day to hear it? It is not that bad I don't think. There is a lagoon out in the middle with cute ducks and black swans swimming. Very entertaining if you get a unit with that view. The grounds are kept nice, and the staff is personable.The airconditioning in the bedrooms are sticking out onto the lanais from the bedrooms. They are all rusted, and there is paint and ick falling all over the lanai. The ones facing the ocean are absolutely gross looking and makes a person definitely not want to turn it on. I know, salt water does damage. I think that would be why they need central air. However, on this island you really don't need it. It is never too hot from my experience. So. all in all, it is okay. You are centrally located to get to the southern or northern end, and you are close to the airport. If I had someone questioning me if they should stay here, I would say yes, but don't expect high end or low. It is mediocre.
reviews.title: Right in the middle of everything on Kauai

likes.liked: — Equidistant to the northern and southern parts of the island
likes.disliked: — After finding out we loved the northern part, driving back to the place after spending the day there
